You can also combine the output of the crawler with the NutchWAX tools 
and Nutch indexing system to achieve search engine functionality -- but 
those are all open-source projects under continuing development, and 
neither Nutch nor NutchWAX has yet been christened with a "1.0" release. 
So many things are possible -- with a little work by someone immersed in 
the code -- but it's not turn-key enough to check off a box.

syed wrote:
> 
>  that means most of the questions are answered no...
>  but those which can be answered yes..if iknow that it would be helpful...
> thanx

Sure, I'll take a quick stab at answering the below for Heritrix. "N/A" 
means "not applicable".

> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Ted Dziuba <ted@...> wrote:
>> Many of these questions can be answered by saying that Heritrix isn't a
>> search engine, it's simply a web crawler.
>>
>> -Ted
>>
>> On Wed, 2007-08-29 at 10:44 +0000, syed wrote:
>>> i have a few questions which have to be answered yes or no in context
>>> whether heritrix has those features or not...
>>>
>>> Character set detection and normalization to UTF8 supported?
No - Heritrix stores responses verbatim.
>>> Metadata extraction is supported for e.g., title, author, date etcâ€¦?
Headers are stored as well as some crawl-time metadata (IP address, 
date-of-retrieval, etc.) -- but only outlinks are extracted from 
document contents.
>>> MIME Type Identifier?
Yes.
>>> External programs or scripts to index other file formats?
N/A.
>>> Configurable stop word list?
N/A.
>>> Removal of stop words from the document index?
N/A.
>>> Removal of stop words from the search query is supported?
N/A.
>>> Duplicate document detection using hashes?
Hertirix 1.12 adds a new capability to preload a crawler with hashes and 
header info from a previous crawl, and then avoid duplicates by either 
conditional GETs (saving bandwidth & storage) or discarding exact 
duplicate content (saving storage).
>>> Filters to enable automatic classification of defined topics?
Outside groups have built classifiers on Heritrix; see for one example 
http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/1905 .
>>> URL filters to prevent repetition of urls and unwanted URL's?
Yes.
>>> Shape descriptor algorithms for the indexing of 3d or 2d models. ?
N/A.
>>> Algorithms to calculate texture feature vectors?
N/A.
>>> Storage of metadata in XML format?
No.
>>> Hash tables with hash values to avoid visiting pages more than once.?
Heritrix avoids revisiting URLs using a sorted URL fingerprint list by 
default, but also has a bloom filter option.
>>> http, https access to secure servers and ftp indexing. ?
Yes -- can access http, https, ftp. Does not index.
>>> **Database querying through Z39.50, SOAP, JDBC and HTTP supported?
No, except for when such queries are followable links. You can extend 
with custom modules to follow other URI types and use other protocols.
>>> Customized request to http server via http header?
You can adjust the HTTP headers sent in various ways.
>>> http server to manage search requests?
N/A.
>>> Cache to store previous results?
N/A.
>>> A proxy to feed user-browsed pages directly into the process-buffer?
Unclear what this means. Heritrix can crawl through an HTTP proxy. Some 
groups have also used proxies during clickthrough QA of web collections 
to auto-detect missing URLs.
>>> A proxy pre-fetch mechanism?
Unclear what this means.
>>> A caching http Proxy with additional function to filter out unwanted
>>> content. ?
See above.
>>> Multidimensional index to store different features of 3d and 2d
>>> models?
N/A.
>>> Buffer to store the documents or document locators?
N/A.
>>> Extraction of information from the http header?
Headers are stored and consulted where relevant (eg URI destination of a 
redirect).
>>> Automatic search term stemming?
N/A.
>>> Standard and advanced search capabilities?
N/A.
>>>
>>> **Relevance ranking ?
N/A.
>>> Advanced search option available?
N/A.
>>> Search interface to input sketches? 
N/A.
>>> Saving common searches supported?
N/A.
>>> Algorithm to select databases a user wishes to query?
N/A.
>>>
>>> Search for different image formats?
N/A.
>>> API for image analysis, storage and format conversion?
N/A.
>>> Multiple OS Support?
Heritrix is officially supported on Linux but as a Java program works 
and is used successfully on Windows and MacOS as well.
>>> Advanced search options, search by color, texture and shape. ?
N/A.
>>> Result page with title, date, file size, and url?
N/A.
>>> Hit highlighting in search results ?
N/A.
>>> http header request and response support?
N/A.
>>> Inverted index?
N/A.
>>> Local database for metadata storage and administration?
N/A.
>>> A database consisting of several distributed hash tables?
N/A.
>>> Document storage?
Yes, retrieved documents are stored verbatim in 'ARC' files.

- Gordon @ IA
